720267f-a.title: Manhattan: Greenwich Street - Gansevoort Street
720267f-a.text:
Greenwich Street, south from Gansevoort Street. The
street car tracks are being removed by the W.P.A. Overhead
is the Ninth Avenue Elevated Line. This is shortly to be
removed. At the right are No's. 838 \& 842 Greenwich Street.
The present Phillips Building replacsd the former, and a
new two story taxpayer the latter. -he highstoop houses
beyond are still standing. This data personally observed
on 9-261940.
June 2, 1937
W. P. A. photo
Five Boroughs Project
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE
720267f-a.folder: Greenwich Street & Gansevoort Street, Manhattan, NY

710297f.title: Manhattan: 9th Avenue - Gansevoort Street
710297f.text:
Ninth Avenue, at Gansevoort Street, showing the ''El''
curve at this point after its emergence out of Green-
wich Street. The photographer is viewing southward
from a point slightly above Little West 12th Street.
The latter appears at the right. Note the drum like
apparatus recuired to continue the wire cable. This
method of locomotion was replaced with small steam
locomotives.
1867-8
Gift of Major Duinn
MAY BE REPRODUCED

719984f-a.title: Manhattan: Gansevoort Street - Greenwich Street
719984f-a.text:
46-56 Cansevoort 3treet, at, adjOininc and west of the W... corner of
GSeenwich Street, as seen fron. under the Ninth Ave. Elevcted. On the riht
is shotn Ho. 3 Ninth Ave., at the I.u. corncr of Gansevoort Street.
July 7, 1933.
F. L. Sperr.
NO RLPRODUCTIONIE.
The New York Times of July 9, 1938 reports that the corner buildings
numbered 46-50 Gansevoort Street and 842-6 Greenwich Street, forming a
plot 92.9 x 69.2 will be improved with a one and two story structure for
offices and storage by the owner, the Spanish-American Mercantile Co. Inc.
at a cost of ~27,0O0; Charles H. Stadler, Engineer.
719984f-a.folder: Gansevoort Street & Greenwich Street, Manhattan, NY

719986f-a.title: Manhattan: Gansevoort Street - Greenwich Street
719986f-a.text:
Gansevoort Street, south side, est from Greenwich Street (9th
Avenue elevated line thereon) showing a portion of the wholesale
produce market that is located in this area. To the left are buildings
on the west side of Greenwich Street extending south from Gansevoort
to Horatio Streets. The empty lot seen in the foreground is at the
S.E. corner of this point.
No. 2 ard 3 show only the Gansevoort Street buildings. On the
right of the former is the Manhattan Refrigerating Co. plant on
Washington Street.
Aumust 11, 1938.
Views 1,2 and 3.
P. L. Sperr
1O REPRODUCTIONS.
719986f-a.folder: Gansevoort Street & Greenwich Street, Manhattan, NY

710296f.title: Manhattan: 9th Avenue - Gansevoort Street
710296f.text:
Ninth Avenue, at Gansevoort Street, showing the curve
in the first ''El'' line at this point. Emerging out of
Greenwich Street, it continues northward to 29th Street.
The view in this instance is southwestward silhouetting
the steel framework against the limited west frontage
lying between Gansevoort and Little West 12th Street.
The last thoroughfare is on the right. Note the flag
poles at the corners of same.
For additional views of this early phase of the Charles
C. Harvey line, see Ninth Avenue at 29th Street, and
Greenwich Street at Dey Street.
1867-8
Gift of Major YEuinn
MAY BE REPRODUCED
:. N: 7
